snippet.title: Bulbs and Roots: Radishes
snippet.description:
Bulbs and Roots: Radishes
Radishes have roots. These roots help the radishes absorb nutrients and water ... (more)
Radishes have roots. These roots help the radishes absorb nutrients and water from the soil. The radish and root are buried underneath the soil. The green leaves are above soil to gather sunlight for the plant. (less)

snippet.title: Carrots
snippet.description:
Carrots
Carrots are like radishes because the carrot and roots are under the ... (more)
Carrots are like radishes because the carrot and roots are under the soil while the green leaves gather sunlight above the soil. If you experiment with sections of the carrot or radish, you will see that cutting just the leaves and replanting them will cause the leaves to wilt and die in a few days. Sections of the carrot or radish will thrive in soil. (less)
